title: Generate payroll with SAGE
content: STEP 1: Create a shortcut to SageFrom a computer with access to your Sage account:Go to your documents,Create a shortcut to your Sage directory :Click the right button of your mouse,In the menu that appears, choose New,In the submenu that appears, choose Shortcut,When asked for location, copy / paste: \\J0xxxFPC10\sageges$\punktelChange the xxx to your enterprise number.Click on the button Next,Name the shortcut: Punches.STEP 2: Generate the payroll reportExportation reportFrom an Emprez session with Administrator rights: In the Pay menu,Choose Export pay,Take the right payroll company if you have more than one,Make sure you have the correct period to treat,Edit the export report to verify the information.Pay SummaryStill from an Emprez session with Administrator rights:In the Pay menu, Choose Pay Summary,Select the right payroll Enterprise if you have more than one,Make sure you have the correct period to treat,Choose the sort order for the classification of employees in the report,Generate.STEP 3: Export data to SageFrom an Emprez session with "Administrator" rights.In the Pay menu, Choose Export pay,Select the right payroll Enterprise if you have more than one,Make sure you have the correct period to treat,Generate.By default, this file will be in the Downloads folder on your computer, if not, make a note of the directory where you saved it.Go to the folder where you saved the file,Copy the file POIN01.DBF previously export, Make sure to remove the number in parentheses. Example: POIN01(2).DBFIf requested, agree to replace/overwrite the existing file,Paste in the Punches shortcut you created in step 1, Open Sage and read the punches.Your export procedure is now complete!If you manage more than one branch, process payroll for the next branch after submitting the first branch's information to Sage. Rename the files to remove the numbers in parentheses. Example: POIN01(2).DBFProblems with payroll transmissionIf Sage does not submit the information, please refer to the checklist below: Check the employee IDStart with employee files, make sure their numbers have a maximum of 7 digits.All Employee ID must be in one or the other of these two formats: Without zeros: 23Or with zeros: 0000023Check the timesheetsMake sure employee timesheets are approved.No unapproved information can be processed by the export.Check the configuration of the Payroll sectionIn Pay > Export pay,Make sure you have the right payroll company, Confirm that the correct pay period is selected,Check if the payroll service is Sage,Check the 3-digit branch number. This is usually three digits, eg.: 003 or 316.Confirm the pay week to export (Week 1 or Week 2).Check the configuration of the shortcut to the Sage "Punches" directoryMake sure the shortcut to the Sage punch directory is listed:    \\J0xxxFPC10\sageges$\punktel The xxx in the shortcut must be replaced by the number of your branchThis must be done by you, because it must be connected to the PJC network to access this directory.CentreRx removes access to the PJC network when it allows an external user to connect to the network computer, which prevents us, Emprez, from completing this verification with you.Make sure the export file is named correctlyThe export file should always be named POIN01.DBFCheck for duplicates, delete if there are anyDelete the additional digits after POIN01 eg.: POIN01(8).DBF, POIN01(7).DBF, POIN01(6).DBFThe file will not be read if the file has the wrong name.Helpful?00Updated: 2 years ago Share :
